entries.content:
üéØ SMOKING GUN FOUND!

Logs show:
1. First message "hel;lo" ‚Üí chatId: 'waiting_for_id' ‚Üí Generated UUID: 3ef02135-5b64-474c-8d56-511d0d77df32
2. Second message "hello" ‚Üí chatId: 'waiting_for_id' ‚Üí Generated UUID: 478f2466-d4b4-4a90-b2ae-4b80f33dd35f

TWO DIFFERENT UUIDs GENERATED! But user says they show "same id" in UI.

This means:
- Extension IS generating different UUIDs ‚úÖ
- BUT UI tabs are showing same ID ‚ùå

The bug is in the UI! AutoTabCreator or the tab rename logic is NOT working. Both tabs are being renamed to the FIRST UUID, not their respective UUIDs!

üéØ REAL BUG IDENTIFIED!

User shows:
- Chat 1 has messages: "hello", "my name is moti" 
- Chat 2 has messages: "hello", "what my name"
- BUT both show SAME SESSION: "d976dbe7-f453"
- AND Chat 2's messages appear in Chat 1!

All responses going to first chat even though they're different tabs!

Problem: When sending message to host, we're NOT taking the CURRENT chat ID from the active tab. We're probably always sending the first tab's chatId or always sending 'waiting_for_id'.

Need to check MessageSendHandler and MessageTransport - where do they get the chatId when sending user messages?
‚ùå CRITICAL ERROR: My changes broke the UI! User is very upset. Need to immediately reverse ALL changes made to AutoTabCreator.js. DO NOT use git - must manually undo the changes.
